title: REVIEW  ---  Play:  News Quiz  ----  By Daniel Akst
text:
1. Founder Ray Dalio stepped down as co-investment chief of Bridgewater. Among U.S. hedge funds, how is it unique?

A. It's the largest.

B. It's the oldest.

C. It's the only one based in Connecticut.

D. It practices "radical opacity."

---

2. Micron said it will spend up to $100 billion to build a semiconductor plant in upstate New York. In which town?

A. Calhoun

B. Clay

C. Sumner

D. Webster

---

3. The U.S. Treasury is considering requiring ingredient disclosures -- on what?

A. Derivatives

B. Annuities

C. Currency

D. Booze

---

4. The White House is preparing to ease sanctions to allow more pumping of Venezuelan oil -- by whom in particular?

A. Chevron

B. Occidental

C. Shell

D. Aramco

---

5. The Nobel Prize in Literature was awarded to Annie Ernaux. What's her nationality?

A. French

B. Belgian

C. Swiss

D. Canadian

---

6. A new exhibit, "Morris Hirshfield Rediscovered," focuses on the self-taught painter -- who owned what shoe company?

A. Stride Rite

B. Florsheim

C. E-Z Walk

D. Keds

---

7. Elon Musk said he'd acquire Twitter at the agreed price after all. How many daily users did it average in the second quarter?

A. 23.78 million

B. 237.8 million

C. 2.378 billion

D. 23.78 billion

---

8. Which law school sent out a slew of mistaken acceptance emails before saying, essentially, "never mind"?

A. Northwestern

B. Southwestern

C. Northeastern

D. Nova Southeastern

---

9. Aaron Judge set a new American League record by hitting his 62nd homer of the season. Who was the pitcher?

A. Tom Zachary

B. Tracy Stallard

C. Dennis Springer

D. Jesus Tinoco

---

ANSWERS

1. A

2. B

3. D

4. A

5. A

6. C

7. B

8. C

9. D
